<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/morning-brew-added-bitcoin-markets-section?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
About the New Markets Section...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/morning-brew-added-bitcoin-markets-section" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Wall Street bull standing next to bitcoin" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85MzgvYml0Y29pbl9idWxsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, the Brew unveiled a brand new design for our Markets section with some pretty big changes. So before we get into the day's business news, we wanted to provide a little insight into why we made the switch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From a graphics POV, we got rid of some unnecessary white space so that, with just a quick glance, you can tell if indicators moved up or down.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You also probably noticed that we removed oil and gold. In their place, we added 1) bitcoin and 2) a "flex" spot, which will allow us to showcase any security—whether it's a tech stock, oil, or dogecoin—that made an interesting move the previous day. Today we picked JPMorgan stock because of the turmoil around the banking sector.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">As for bitcoin…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After much consideration we believe the time has come to feature it daily at the top of the newsletter. Perhaps you just took a tequila shot out of happiness. Maybe you just chucked your computer out the window in a fit of rage.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So why'd we do it? </strong>Simply put: Its price is noteworthy. Bitcoin, as the flagship cryptocurrency, has grown tremendously as an asset over the last decade, earning wider acceptance among Fortune 500 companies, institutional financial firms, and individual investors alike. We think our Markets section will be more relevant to readers with bitcoin in it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By the way, this is not an endorsement of bitcoin—we have no opinion on whether you should buy or sell it. It's simply a recognition that finance, just like anything else, is changing, and our newsletter should reflect that.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F03%2F29%2Fmorning-brew-added-bitcoin-markets-section" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Why%27d+we+do+it%3F+Simply+put%3A+Its+price+is+noteworthy&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/morning-brew-added-bitcoin-markets-section&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/us-vaccine-progress-faces-off-rising-caseloads?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
US Gets a Side Stitch on the Anchor Leg
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/us-vaccine-progress-faces-off-rising-caseloads" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Line to get Covid shots" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzc5L2xpbmVfdG9fZ2V0X2NvdmlkX3Nob3RzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After a brutal winter surge, Covid-19 cases fell dramatically in late February and managed to sit steady for a month. But now, despite a vaccine campaign that's trounced expectations like a Beeple NFT, numbers are creeping back up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The seven-day rolling average for new cases is back above 60,000 and rising, and deaths (which typically lag a couple weeks) are up 3%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CDC Director Rochelle Walensky is worried. At an emotional press conference yesterday, she <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/03/29/cdc-chief-covid-cases-surge-478340?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> of "impending doom" from another surge and implored the public to take a page from Prof. Moody and practice some constant vigilance. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Onto the better news</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over one-third of adults (about 95 million people) have received at least one shot, according to the CDC. Almost 53 million are fully vaccinated. And within three weeks, President Biden <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/29/biden-to-announce-90percent-of-us-adults-will-eligible-for-covid-shots-by-april-19-with-sites-within-five-miles-of-home.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says</a>, 90% of adults will be eligible to receive the vaccine within five miles of their home.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the CDC also <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/cdc-pfizer-moderna-covid-vaccines-found-90-percent-effective-real-n1262334?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that the first "real world" study of the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines showed 90% efficacy <em>and</em> that they help prevent asymptomatic infections. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The first shot alone confers 80% protection, although experts aren't sure how long that lasts without the second booster shot. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But unlike those who promise to "grab lunch soon," vaccine recipients have followed up: Almost 96% of two-shot recipients get their second dose in the recommended time-frame. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Rising caseloads reinforce that more vaccines doesn't immediately translate to less Covid in the short-term. Yesterday, Biden <a href="https://www.axios.com/biden-governors-state-mask-mandates-f35a273b-1c24-4e9e-89ab-f689fc4030b5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pleaded</a> with state and local leaders to maintain or reinstate mask mandates as the rollout continues. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here...</strong>the latest installment in <em>Covid-19: Origin Story</em>. In a draft report obtained by the AP, WHO researchers investigating the coronavirus said it <a href="https://apnews.com/article/who-report-animals-source-covid-19-coronavirus-8a839c179c330c56fa46a763b7286a7f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most likely jumped</a> from bats to another critter to humans. A lab leak was determined to be "extremely unlikely."</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SHIPPING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/suez-canal-cleared-blocks-effects-will-still-felt?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If You Love Something, Let It Float
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/suez-canal-cleared-blocks-effects-will-still-felt" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Marine map with circle around Ever Given" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTQ3L2V2ZXJfZ2l2ZW4ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MarineTime</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, folks, we did it. With the power of jokes, tugboats, and high tide, the Ever Given was <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-suezcanal-ship-refloat/traffic-in-suez-canal-resumes-after-stranded-ship-refloated-idUSKBN2BL1VK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">freed</a> from the Suez Canal yesterday after nearly a week of blocking it. While the ship might want to return to the anonymity of container transportation and leave the paparazzi behind, it's not that easy: The backlog of traffic at the Suez could take almost a week to clear and could ultimately create more congestion as ships begin to arrive at their destinations at the same time. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The average </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-29/the-world-s-other-major-shipping-pileup-is-still-clogging-trade?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wait time</a></span><span> for a berth at ports in the LA area, the biggest US gateway for goods from Asia, is already about eight days thanks to existing logjams.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The clog blocked more than 10% of global shipping traffic and brought up lots of talk about the <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/03/29/982233995/ship-happens-coffee-cars-ikea-furniture-among-the-objects-stuck-at-the-suez?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fragility</a> of global supply chains. </p>

<small><em>Thomas Samson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> 10.7% of adolescents aged 12 to 17 became <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-29/cannabis-almost-as-addictive-as-opioids-among-teens-study-finds?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">addicted to marijuana</a> within a year of trying it for the first time, according to a new study published yesterday in JAMA Pediatrics. That's comparable to the same age group's addiction rate (11.2%) for prescription opioids.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"It had essentially gorged on more debt than it could handle." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bloomberg columnist Tim O'Brien argued that the liquidation of Archegos Capital, an obscure hedge fund that bet big on stocks like ViacomCBS and Discovery and was forced to sell off $20 billion in shares on Friday, is symbolic of a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-03-29/archegos-capital-meltdown-echoes-long-term-capital-management-debacle?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lack of transparency</a> on Wall Street. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How mRNA technology could change the world. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2021/03/how-mrna-technology-could-change-world/618431/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/lil-nas-x-mschf-sneaker-collab-making-everyone-mad?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hell's Hottest Spring Look
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/29/lil-nas-x-mschf-sneaker-collab-making-everyone-mad" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Singer Lil Nas X holds "Satan" Nikes in front of face' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTQ4L3NhdGFuX3Nob2VzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MSCHF</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lil Nas X's unofficial “<a href="https://www.gq.com/story/lil-nas-x-satan-nike-sneakers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Satan” Nikes</a> sold out of its 666 pairs in under a minute on Monday. The updated Nike Air Max 97s are part of a collab between the “Old Town Road” singer and New York-based art collective MSCHF, which is known for online stunts including <a href="https://www.cnn.com/style/article/damien-hirst-mschf-severed-spots/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chopping</a> up a $30k fine art print last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The sneakers allegedly contain a drop of real human blood mixed into the red ink sloshing around inside the air bubble. Nike was quick to say it didn’t create, endorse, or bleed into the sneaker—which was important because the release created a firestorm on social media. Everyone from South Dakota’s governor, <a href="https://twitter.com/govkristinoem/status/1376239196709478400?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kristi Noem</a>, to football player <a href="https://twitter.com/Trevorlawrencee/status/1376267722233839620?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Trevor Lawrence</a> tweeted their varying levels of…disappointment about the eternally damned shoes this weekend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Lil Nas X timed the sneaker drop with his most recent music video release for “Montero (Call Me By Your Name),” the steamiest take on going to H-E-L-L we’ve ever seen.</p>

#1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epretty well\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e following the hedge fund blow-up that captivated Wall Street this weekend. Expect more ups and downs in trading this week as investors adjust their positions ahead of Q1’s close.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, the Brew unveiled a brand new design for our Markets section with some pretty big changes. So before we get into the day's business news, we wanted to provide a little insight into why we made the switch.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom a graphics POV, we got rid of some unnecessary white space so that, with just a quick glance, you can tell if indicators moved up or down.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou also probably noticed that we removed oil and gold. In their place, we added 1) bitcoin and 2) a \"flex\" spot, which will allow us to showcase any security—whether it's a tech stock, oil, or dogecoin—that made an interesting move the previous day. Today we picked JPMorgan stock because of the turmoil around the banking sector.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAs for bitcoin…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter much consideration we believe the time has come to feature it daily at the top of the newsletter. Perhaps you just took a tequila shot out of happiness. Maybe you just chucked your computer out the window in a fit of rage.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo why'd we do it? \u003c/strong\u003eSimply put: Its price is noteworthy. Bitcoin, as the flagship cryptocurrency, has grown tremendously as an asset over the last decade, earning wider acceptance among Fortune 500 companies, institutional financial firms, and individual investors alike. We think our Markets section will be more relevant to readers with bitcoin in it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy the way, this is not an endorsement of bitcoin—we have no opinion on whether you should buy or sell it. It's simply a recognition that finance, just like anything else, is changing, and our newsletter should reflect that.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter a brutal winter surge, Covid-19 cases fell dramatically in late February and managed to sit steady for a month. But now, despite a vaccine campaign that's trounced expectations like a Beeple NFT, numbers are creeping back up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe seven-day rolling average for new cases is back above 60,000 and rising, and deaths (which typically lag a couple weeks) are up 3%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCDC Director Rochelle Walensky is worried. At an emotional press conference yesterday, she \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/03/29/cdc-chief-covid-cases-surge-478340?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarned\u003c/a\u003e of \"impending doom\" from another surge and implored the public to take a page from Prof. Moody and practice some constant vigilance. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOnto the better news\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver one-third of adults (about 95 million people) have received at least one shot, according to the CDC. Almost 53 million are fully vaccinated. And within three weeks, President Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/29/biden-to-announce-90percent-of-us-adults-will-eligible-for-covid-shots-by-april-19-with-sites-within-five-miles-of-home.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays\u003c/a\u003e, 90% of adults will be eligible to receive the vaccine within five miles of their home.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the CDC also \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/cdc-pfizer-moderna-covid-vaccines-found-90-percent-effective-real-n1262334?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e that the first \"real world\" study of the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines showed 90% efficacy \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e that they help prevent asymptomatic infections. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe first shot alone confers 80% protection, although experts aren't sure how long that lasts without the second booster shot. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut unlike those who promise to \"grab lunch soon,\" vaccine recipients have followed up: Almost 96% of two-shot recipients get their second dose in the recommended time-frame. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eRising caseloads reinforce that more vaccines doesn't immediately translate to less Covid in the short-term. Yesterday, Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/biden-governors-state-mask-mandates-f35a273b-1c24-4e9e-89ab-f689fc4030b5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epleaded\u003c/a\u003e with state and local leaders to maintain or reinstate mask mandates as the rollout continues. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here...\u003c/strong\u003ethe latest installment in \u003cem\u003eCovid-19: Origin Story\u003c/em\u003e. In a draft report obtained by the AP, WHO researchers investigating the coronavirus said it \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/who-report-animals-source-covid-19-coronavirus-8a839c179c330c56fa46a763b7286a7f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost likely jumped\u003c/a\u003e from bats to another critter to humans. A lab leak was determined to be \"extremely unlikely.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
